meanings.definition: The act of selling off excess or unsold stock at a reduced price.
meanings.sent1: The remaindering of old inventory helped the store make space for new products.
meanings.sent2: After the holiday season, many stores engage in remaindering to clear out leftover items.
meanings.sent3: The comical sidekick joked that his superpower was the ability to make anything disappear through remaindering.
meanings.sent4: The concept of remaindering old ideas to make room for fresh perspectives is like a spring cleaning for the mind.
meanings.sent5: The art of remaindering involves finding value in what others may overlook.

meanings.definition: The leftover or remaining part of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully wrapped the remaindering of the cake to save for later.
meanings.sent2: The remaindering of the day was spent relaxing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel made a nest out of the remaindering of the picnic leftovers.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the remaindering of light cast a warm glow over the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The remaindering of the puzzle pieces made it clear where they should fit.
